Procurement Officer Job at Rotic Aluminium Extrusion




        
    

        
        Rotic Aluminium Extrusion is a steadily growing aluminium extrusion companyin Anambra. We are dedicated to delivering the highest standard of aluminium extrusion profiles. Our seasoned team of experts ensures that each product we create embodies precision and craftsmanship.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer

Job Location: Awka, Anambra 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are currently seeking a Procurement Officer at our facility in Awka, Anambra State, to effectively manage the procurement of raw materials, oversee inbound logistics, and ensure timely replenishments to support the company's operational needs.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage all procurement processes for raw materials and other inbound goods.
	Source and evaluate suppliers, negotiate contracts, and ensure cost-effective procurement.
	Oversee the receipt of all inbound logistics and keep records of all goods received.
	Inspect and verify incoming goods against purchase orders to ensure accuracy.
	Maintain accurate records of all goods in the inbound store.
	Monitor inventory levels of the inbound store to ensure timely replenishments.
	Coordinate with suppliers to manage lead times and delivery schedules.
	Make daily, weekly and monthly reports on the usage of raw materials for the management review.
	Ensure compliance with company procurement policies and procedures.
	Collaborate with other departments to forecast material needs.
	Resolve any issues related to supplier performance or delivery delays.
	Participate in the development and implementation of procurement strategies.


Requirements and Qualifications


	Minimum of HND in Accounting, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	At least 2 years of proven experience in an accounting, procurement or similar role.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills
	Attention to detail and ability to maintain accurate records.
	Ability to analyze data and prepare reports.
	Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced manufacturing environment.


Salary
N90,000 - N120,000 monthly.

Method of Applicat
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@roticaluminium.com using “Procuremnt Officer” as the subject of the email.

Note: If you are an experienced procurement professional with a keen eye for detail and a strong focus on efficiency, join us in ensuring our products reach our customers accurately and on time.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT Officer",
  "description": "First Ally Capital is a wholly indigenous Financial Services firm, whose focus is on providing top notch advisory &amp; investment services to individuals and organizations. First Ally Capital was incorporated on May 20, 2014 as an Issuing House, Financial Advisory and Investment Management firm, with authorized capital of N2.5 billion, and an issued and fully-paid capital of N1.65 billion. The firm was licensed by the Securities and Exchange Commission on November 20, 2014 as Issuing House and Underwriters.

The Firm commenced operations at a very significant point in the evolution of the Nigerian financial services industry and will leverage it&rsquo;s solid capital base, the strong financial services background of its promoters and the excellent track-record and credentials of its directors and shareholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;IT Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job Type: Full Time (On-site)

Job Summary


	The IT Officer provides technical support to all users.
	The IT Officer monitors and maintains computer networks, installs and configures hardware and software and solves all technical problems that may arise.


Duties and responsibilities


	Installing and configuring computer hardware, software, systems, networks, printers and scanners.
	Monitoring and maintaining computer systems and networks.
	Responding in a timely manner to service issues and requests.
	Providing technical support across the branches of the bank.
	Ensure security of data, network access and backup systems.
